transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on machine) Can you all come down to jail and get me out of jail? 'Cause guess where I am. Jail.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, guess what? (coughs and sniff) Last night I was having dinner and discovered I didn't have any money.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So I told my dining companion...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The waiter, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, the waiter. So I told him that we were going to have to sneak out. And get this: You know what the guy says to me? "I'm your waiter."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So anyway, after the police had arrived, I ordered more food. I mean, I thought I'd pay him for the food I ate with the food I just ordered. What's wrong with that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost and Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (simultaneously) So I decided to pay the bill--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost and Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (more deliberate) I decided--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost and Zorak
transcript.dialogue: --to pay--

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: --the bail bond--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) The bail bond!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost and Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (quickly) --with this week's show budget!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know, we've had this conversation at least four times.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, reach down my pants and get the show budget to pay the bail.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You know you want to.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: ...I know.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hup.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, er. Uhh, this is it, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What were you doing with one thousand dollars?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) Whoa, it was in your pants.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Umm--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, what would you have me to do, Zorak? (invisos out of cell, reappearing between Zorak and Moltar) Reach down my pants in public in front of the female police?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I didn't say anything--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, but you're (CLOWN HORN)ing thinking it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm not (CLOWN HORN)ing it. I'll, I'll tell you what I am thinking. I think you took that thousand dollars--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And put it in my underwear, yes. Then went out to dinner, yes. And then you came to jail. Yes.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (southern accent) So, here we are bailing you out of jail for something questionable again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So, we're spending the show budget to get you out of jail.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes! Er, no, because--

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no, molten man. Look, here's what we're doing. We don't need a budget, we're...doing a remote!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Umm, I'll go get-- Should I go get the camera?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What? We're going to do the show without cameras?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, maybe you would maybe get out of this jail 15 minutes before the show starts with no ideas, but maybe one idea that's brilliant, like no cameras on this remote.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh ho. I'll tell you what sucks -- your ideas!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, why don't you just ask the box office?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (reading page of script) And I say, "Ask 'em what?"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And I reply... (holds up script) "For ideas, ashhole! They have 'em."

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What are you talkin' about?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Here's an idea:

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost and Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (simultaneously) We'll use the old Susan Powter interview.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where do you get this stuff? That's awesome. You're a genius! And will be promoted by the end of this show.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ehh. We've had /this/ conversation at least five times!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know what? You're fired. Send in the next candidate.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I didn't see you there! Oh, screw it, you're hired and promoted!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: All right.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (with his back to the others) I can tell you what I'm doing. (breaks wind) Smell that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There's someone who's using their ass.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Way to fart with your ass, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, thanks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, who's hungry? (conspiratorially) I'll meet you back at the set because I have a scheme.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ehh, why don't we just stay here? We're going to end up here anyway.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? You're on the ball.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: All right. (rustling papers) Uhh, these are all the things that we will say here now.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mm-kay. Good.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And, uhh, on a personal note, I just wanted to thank you in advance for rehiring and promoting me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good, you are now king. Good work! Now, let's get back to the set because I have another idea! Because my brain is coming up with ideas. Period.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Roll the Susan Powter interview!

transcript.speaker: Susan Powter
transcript.dialogue: Well, I may as well-- I may as well tell you here, sitting here with you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) Hello, Susan!

transcript.speaker: Susan Powter
transcript.dialogue: I'm really a transsexual, actually. I'm not a woman at all.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) Wait, pause tape. This isn't working.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Moltar, roll an old show. I'm going to interview it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (exhales quickly) Huh, uh, all right. (pulls lever, screen goes black)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Moltar, reach down my pants and get the show budget to pay the bail.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) No!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hello, show!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) You know you want to.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) ...I know. Hup.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just use any answer, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Oh, er. Uhh, this is it, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) What were you doing with one thousand dollars?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) Do you see what they're doing in that show?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Whoa, it was in your pants.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We could do that.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Umm--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Well, what would you have me to do, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (overlapping) Except for you, Zorak. You're messing it up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Reach down my pants in public in front of the female police?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nobody cares for you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) I didn't say anything--

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Oh, but you're (CLOWN HORN)ing thinking it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, I've got an idea. (throws lever, monitor on set goes gray) There's not enough of me punching you in the crotch.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmm. Both of you? (looks at Zorak) Has that been done before?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I don't know.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Probably, but it'll be fun.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (offscreen) Good idea, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But you're going to have to catch me first.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uhh, hoo.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Here, scoot over.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: There we go.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Umm, you can't feel this, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This is good, this is working, even though my idea to run away did not occur. (continues humming)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You know what? I think we have done this. Plus, my arm's getting tired.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stops throwing punches) I could do this all day, but there's no plot.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (standing up) No, this is the plot.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (walking away) I gotta take a break.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, fine, sure. Throw the story away.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, why don't you just buy a crotch-punching robot?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up. I'm getting an idea. (sits down) Since people love robots and robots love crotches...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I need you to go on the Internet with your money and order up a punch-crotching robot! Now the story has legs.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Only I don't have any money, or the Internet.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Impossible! Refresh all dialogue with Internet possibilities! Sign on with my screenname.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Okay... What's your screenname?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (arms folded) Refresher, password "dianarossfan."

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Huh-ho! You like her? (evil laugh, which continues underneath)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Who doesn't?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up! Now I don't like her. (Zorak stops laughing) Now, if you'll all go back to your chairs, look under your chairs and you'll find bombs that you can explode by! Thank you. The end.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Umm, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. (beat) Here's another idea: I'll dress up like Mark Twain and do my one-man show with Zorak and Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gravely) "Racism is Bad," a one-man show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I begin. St. Louis, 1972. A riverboat makes its way down the river towards... towards... (looks at Moltar and Zorak for help) You know, it was on PBS. Ireland. Was it Ireland? (looks at Moltar and Zorak again) Dancing, the dancing guys. You know!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Which one? The "Riverdance" guy?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No. The, the-- Oh... (puts hand over his face in shame)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Umm, Michael Jordan?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: But somebody Jordan. (beat) Michael Jordan?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mm mm, no. But somebody Jordan. Get out a phone book and read every name. I'll know it when I hear it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What, are you asking me seriously?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What are we doing again?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, I like how it starts, but I need an ending for "Racism is Bad," because some races are bad, but let's not get lost in the ending because I think it works.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: How about you (CLOWN HORN) off?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But wait. Ho-hold on. Read that back to me. I like where that's going.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What? The (CLOWN HORN) off part?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, that's working. Read that back to me.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Umm... Read that back to me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, read /that/ back to me.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (without inflection) Read that back to me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, you're doing it all wrong. Now, read that back to /me/.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Readthat...back...to...me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wrong! Start from the jail!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Why are you doing this to me?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no, no. Why are /you/ doing this to /me/?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Why are you doing this to /me/?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Brilliant! See, if we work on it, it works.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, I thought the crotch-punching thing was working.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? Well, let's start that again.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, hell yeah!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) You know, I like it, But I-- I don't know. Just something's missing from it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The only thing missing is you sawing your head off with a knife.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, stop. Now we're getting jokey. (gets down) Enough with the jokes, okay? We're not trying to make jokes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We're trying to tell a story here. A story...about an omelette.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about I cook an omelette?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That's good writing, but is it a good ending?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Sure it is!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But will the audience believe it?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ehh, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmm. Then we'll have to make them believe it, with our savory hobbit omelette.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Now /this/ is an ending.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shut up, Moltar! Now that's the ending.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Is that the ending for the Mark Twain show or for our show?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It doesn't matter.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost made an omelette.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, I'm not really hungry.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Me, neither.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmm. Well, someone needs to eat this. Call Dr. Science and have him rewire the crotch-punching robot into an omelette-eating robot.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay. (long beat while he stands in place) He says he can't do it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then ask him if he wants the omelette. (beat while Moltar stays where he is) Are you talking to Dr. Science, right now?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yyyy-yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because it look like you're just standing there.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, I just called him, and he said the robot can only punch omelettes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Brilliant! Bullsh(CLOWN HORN)! He can make that robot do anything he wants. Get him on the phone.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Or maybe /you/ should get him on the phone since you have this amazing technology to call him.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's this?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (hick voice) Why, it looks like a robot! Hit it with a stick, Daddy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can this whole show be deleted? Well, what do you think?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, what the hell's going on? What are these words doing here?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: These are the credits.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: If I wanted to read a book I'd go to the carnival.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's this word?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: "It."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So that's how "it"'s spelled.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Huh.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Son of a gun. (Cut to Space Ghost pointing to the second word on sign. We can now see "IT IS DANG" and "TO STAND." The background here is also black.)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do this one.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: "Is."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, it looks just like the other word.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, it...starts off the same way.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Damn!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Read that one!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's, uhh...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (having trouble) "Dan...ger..."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no. We'll pass that one. Read this one instead.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ow! Oh, God!
